alert.note: Alert for Cibola (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 3:38PM MDT until August 07 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL CIBOLA COUNTY... At 338 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain has ended across the warned area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain fell in the area along Black Mesa Road, Pueblo Road, Airport Road, Haaku Road, and Acomita Road. An additional 1 inch of rain is possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... McCartys, Skyline-Ganipa, San Fidel, Acomita Lake, Acomita, North Acomita Village and Seama. This includes the following highways... State Road 30, Pueblo Road, State Road 124, Silver Ridge Road, Anzac Road, Acomita Road, and Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 90 and 102. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
